title: Configurable Polling Intervals for Indexer
body:
<!--

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently the op-indexer ETL [polls](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/0200fa460f03382bb4d3ec4c80c165ebf6bf485b/indexer/etl/etl.go#L16-L22) both L1 and L2 for new block events every 5 seconds. These values could be irrespective or non-proportional to actual block production rates for some L1/L2 chains. Additionally a default interval of 5 seconds may be too slow for reading L2 blocks provided the current rate of L2 block production on OP Stack chains (2 seconds per block). 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Add support for configurable millisecond poll interval values (`L1_POLL_INTERVAL`, `L2_POLL_INTERVAL`) that allow a user to configure the respective polling rates per each chain. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
N/A

Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
